alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 5:00PM MST until August 24 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 458 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott, Copper Basin, Sunset Lookout, Aspen Creek Trailhead, Wilhoit, Ponderosa Park, Rancho Vista Estates, Wolf Creek Falls, and Groom Creek. This includes the following swimming holes... Wolf Creek Falls. This includes State Route 89 between mile markers 295 and 308. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Miller Creek, Bannon Creek, Orofino Wash, Butte Creek, Hassayampa River, Granite Creek, Kirkland Creek, Finch Wash, Skull Valley Wash and Sheppard Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
